column4: I'd like to be able to VNC into an Ubuntu machine running 9.04 Server, but it doesn't seem to be working.  Do I need other things installed aside from vnc4server?
vnc capability is installed out-of-the-box - go to System | Preferences | Remote Desktop
so no X ... isn't that why vnc will give black screen ... ?
I don't know, that's sort of why I'm asking
What do I need to install, then, for VNC to work?
do you want a desktop, or a SSH ?
I can already SSH, I want to be able to VNC into the server
then you'll need to install a window manager and X
okay, do you know what the package for X is called?
gnome-desktop should pull everything down you need
what window manager do you want to use ?
I think I got it working
